location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on November 26, 2020
text: Product came opened, with no seal. The box was roughed up, and had marks on it as if it was a used retuned item. I bought it as a gift, when I opened the pencil it looked slightly different than the one I had. Upon testing the pencil I realized that the magnet was not as strong and the pencil itself was a bit thinner than the one I have. I then compared it to my sisters Apple pencil and found the same defects. It seemed like either a really good fake that had been returned in an original box. Very very disappointed, quality control was zero, I could have otherwise just gotten it from the apple store but because of time constraint opted to do so with PRIME. Also, this product was to be sent overseas so returning it is going to be a nuisance from a different country. HIGHLY disappointed. Never buying apple products from amazon again, do not trust the verification at all.

title: Garbage. And Apple support is even worse
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on June 13, 2021
text: Wasn't working well to begin with but initially I thought it was user error because I never used an Apple Pencil. After various troubleshooting efforts it was just frustrating to use so I left it alone forever. I finally tried it again because I signed up for a digital art course only to learn the Apple Pencil stopped working entirely. I tried to troubleshoot it myself following all the instructions on Apple's website. Nothing worked so I reached out to Apple "support" (biggest joke of the decade). I got booted after half an hour of frustration being pointed back to the page on how to troubleshoot the product myself, and that it'd be $119.99 + $20 for repair plus shipping. Don't do this to yourself

So how easy is it to rip people off this way.I have an iPad with an 1st gen and it can go days with out a charge..This 2nd gen can be fully charged and dies in about 90 mins..?Literally like stealing 130 dollars because it's basically useless at this point for any type of real world scenarios.

I open to try it immediately and its sleek design does not fail to amaze me - you could tell simplicity is the ultimate sophistication. It is compatible with my iPad properly (the iPad 4th generation) and magnetically attaches to iPad, charges wirelessly.2. I have tried the pen with my daily routine experience with the iPad: scrolling websites, writing notes, doing some sketches randomly etc... and the feeling is just great! To be honest, I am not a person familiar with stylus but it does not take me a long time to get used to this pen since it is really easy to use.Overall, with the great deal of this product, I am very satisfied of this product and if it is sale off again I think I would buy one for my acquaintance.

title: "new" arrived broken, beat up, filthy and utterly nonfunctional
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on November 2, 2022
text: I had this specific item in my wishlist, which one of my fans purchased new for me. It arrived at the very last minute and, upon opening, I found that the box was scuffed and marked up. I opened it and found that the pen was crooked and dirty (I wiped it down before taking the picture), and the nib was bent. Well, I tried to use the thing on my tablet, which is also brand new, and it did connect, but was utterly unresponsive for any function. It did not register any strokes, it will change modes... just nothing. It didn't even register on the setup. I have spare nibs and made to change it. But when I twist it off, and very gently, mind you, it broke apart at the threads, which are now stuck in the pen. The little brass bit is scratched, scuffed, dented and bet. Even if my fan bought it as used, which he said he didn't, this thing was completely broken and in totally unacceptable condition.

title: Apple Magic Pencil 2 ‚Äì Failed Outside of Warranty
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on October 28, 2022
text: Wow, what a disappointment this product is. I paid $130 up front. It is now completely bricked (confirmed by online customer support and genius bar appointment). No explanation why. If you read the myriad of help articles online you will see various explanations related to the users failure to keep the pen charged at all times. While no one ever warned me of that, I can assure you that my pencil stayed clipped to the magsafe charger on the ipad at all times. I also never did anything else to the pencil that would explain it‚Äôs sudden failure.I used this pencil occasionally for work to take notes. ~1-2 times per week. Very light usage overall. It was working totally normally less than a week before it‚Äôs complete demise.As a product the pencil does its job well enough. I can‚Äôt point to anything extraordinary. It is better than a stylus, but not significantly different than its more modern competitors. I was happy to pay $130 for a product a presumed would be functional for a reasonable lifetime, however with so many reports of early failures (days/weeks outside of warranty), the value is just not there.Apple offers only a $20 credit for a bricked magic pencil 2. That means they expect me to pay another $110 for a replacement pencil after mine failed in marginally over a year. Completely unacceptable. I have already begun my migration away from apple, and after this failure I will only accelerate my efforts. I will not be replacing this pencil. I will not replace this ipad when it dies. In all likelihood I will not even purchase another iPhone.

title: Tracking is Bogus
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on December 1, 2021
text: Now, for one thing, you should really buy these from Apple‚Äôs website, but anyway‚Ä¶I used the first-generation for years, and it was practically perfect. It rarely ever acted up. This, however, is total garbage. While it is super convenient to charge it directly onto your iPad, the double-tap to switch between pencil and eraser is SUPER touchy, and is CONSTANTLY getting in my way! For another thing, the tracking is absolute trash. There will be times when I‚Äôm using, say, a pencil brush in an art app, (and these sorts of pens/apps have a feature that if you slant the pen, the brush will flatten and widen like if you used the side of a real pencil) but for some reason, even when I‚Äôm holding my pen perfectly upright and straight, it thinks that it should act as though it‚Äôs slanted, and so, instead of a neat, straight line, I get a barf of thick, wobbly lines that I constantly have to undo. And this goes for every single brush I use! The cursor (as it were) will jump to the side, or curve, or goodness knows what else! I don‚Äôt know if this is some sort of ‚Äúnew design feature‚Äù or what, but it only serves to give me a headache and waste my time. If you can avoid it, I would not purchase a second-gen Apple Pencil. First gen is all you need.

title: Worthy upgrade!
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on April 24, 2019
text: I have the Apple iPad Pro 2018 (3rd generation) and this pencil is a wonderful addition to an already amazing piece of technology!I use this to take notes, dabble in graphic design, and even some gaming.I did have the generation one Apple Pencil (not compatible with the 3rd gen iPad Pro) and that was a good Pencil bit this one has much better response! The gesture tap is a great feature to make use much quicker for changing settings. The pencil charges fast and it magnetizes to the iPad making charging a breeze! The texture is also improved and feels more like a natural pencil and the flat edge - there for charging purposes - actually makes for a more comfortable grip!I do suggest getting a textured glass screen protector. It makes the iPad feel more like drawing and writing on paper.

title: Mine wouldn‚Äôt charge

Turned iPad on and then charging it finally worked. Don‚Äôt know what that was about. Thought this might be useful to some out there if they‚Äôve had this problem. Pencil is amazing. title: life changing for students
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on October 27, 2019
text: While the ipad and apple pencil were physically painful to purchase I can't sing their praises enough. As a full time grad student these tools are invaluable to me. I wish I would have had them in undergrad. I tried several other budget friendly stylists on the ipad before breaking down and getting the real deal and there just isn't anything out there that compares to the apple pencil when it comes to accuracy and sensitivity. If note taking, drawing, and studying are a part of your daily life you need this.

title: Will not continue to function if you let the battery run out
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on July 26, 2022
text: It took quite a bit of research after my Apple Pencil died to figure out that it is incapable of recharging once the battery has depleted one time.  If you constantly use it and never let the battery level drop, you may be fine, but if you would only be an occasional user and plan on ever storing it, you will find yourself with a paperweight.  Actually, it would make a terrible paperweight because when it did work, I found that it rolled away every chance it got; the one flat edge does nothing to stop that.  It's also very difficult to keep that flat edge where you want it in your hand for tapping on, which was a huge headache.

title: Great but it totally died
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on June 2, 2021
text: I had pencil for about a year and it was really nice. I do draw on my iPad so it was a great thing to have. It was convenient to have it attach magnetically and it worked well.However, one day recently it just didn't work. The pencil stopped pairing and will not charge anymore.  Apple won't replace it because it is out of warranty of course. Apple wanted more than I paid to fix it as well. I am pretty upset a 130 dollar (I paid 120 then) stylus died in a year but debating on a new one.Apple support did verify with me though that there is a known issue (which they don't seem to warn people on) that if these pencil's die and are not charged soon after, it will kill the pencil's battery. I do believe this is what happened to mine. With that said, don't take the chance.. keep it charged.  Hopefully this helps someone out.

The added epiphany is in my case I have to replace my apple pencil tips every two months as I use a paper-like screen protector (4 months for no screen protector scenario). If you are running short of budget, I would suggest you buy a third party apple pencil which does the job decent enough.

title: Too Fragile

text: Liked:*East to pair with the iPad.*Functionality is very good and precise.*Feels "pretty" good in my hand.*Charges quickly and maintains a good charge for all tasksDid not like:*The magnetic holder fails and can come loose and be separated from the iPad*Too fragile.  I have broken two transducers inside the tip due to an accidential drop, causing me to replace  the whole pencil at over a hundred bucks.Would like to see:*Apple needs to replace some of the plastic inner parts with metal, or something more substancial.*A flat side on the pencil, meant to stop the pencil from rolling, does not work and needs to be redesigned.*Put a cap on the tip (similar to a real pen) for extra protection.Overall:  Would not recommend due to the high cost and fragility.

title: Decent experience but needs a screen protector that adds friction.  Terrible battery life.
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on July 30, 2019
text: I have seen a lot of reviews over the two major types of styluses that people talk about.  I have both.  I have had the Pencil on my 12.9 iPad Pro and now on my 11" 2018 iPad Pro model.  The last version was very responsive, but really, really clunky to use.  Too long and the battery life was horrible.  This newer version is better, but still has horrid battery life and loses connectivity, frequently.  Apple solved both of these by reconnecting the device every time you recharge it, which is good.  No other company could get away with this kind of experience.By comparison, the stylus on my Surface Pro 6 has a natural level of friction on the screen, but the response rate isn't as fast.  That said, the battery life and connection reliability are WAY ahead of the Apple Pencil 2.  It never loses connection and the battery life is more like 2 years than 2 days, like the Pencil.  Yes, I know that the MS one uses a battery, but so what.  The battery lasts forever, does more than the Pencil and costs less.  Hard to give the Pencil a great value rating.

title: Do not purchase!
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on September 27, 2020
text: I bought this for for my high school daughter who is doing school through distance learning on her IPad Pro (12.9‚Äù 2020).  It literally rolled off her desk and fell 2.5 feet and the tip (plastic and metal internal piece) broke off on falling. After spending $1100 on the iPad Pro and $129 on the pencil 2, I web chatted with Apple and then talked to some one at a local Apple store (who seemed more interested in logging in‚Äôs my conversation into an iPad than talking to me). Their response: ‚Äú did you buy the $120 insurance on the iPad? If not, then go away, I can‚Äôt help you, next.‚Äù Seriously. I have a hard time writing this owning countless Apple products and owning a good amount of their stock, but this is awful. I expect more. Either build better products or stand behind theme better. I will likely buy an off market brand as it can not be worse. Thanks Apple (said sarcastically), you customer support will make you become the next IBM (who? Exactly!).

title: Tip broke off in two months
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on February 3, 2019
text: I am very dissapointed in my Apple pencil. I did buy it from Best Buy, not Apple but wanted to warn others of a major defect.  It worked well and always paired but after two months I dropped it from TWO feet and the tip broke off!  When it broke off the bottom ring was wedged into the base of the pencil and could not be removed.  I reported it to Apple and they said that "the pencil was not made to withstand ANY drop".  Seriously, who doesn't drop a pencil or stylus from time to time?  I will not be replacing my pencil if they can not make something more durable than this.

title: Broke after a month

text: This product has been endlessly frustrating since it first stopped working after a month of minimal use.Even when the Pencil is connected to my iPad via Bluetooth, has full charge, and a brand new nib (tightly fastened), on a freshly cleaned screen, it just doesn't work. It does not register on the screen at all. I even tried removing the Paperlike screen protector I got in case that would get it to register again. No luck.I was able to get it working following some of the above methods once or twice (particularly tightening the nib), but it just goes back to broken the same day.Clearly, there's something wrong with the hardware itself, but I bought this from an actual Apple Store for $130, which are unfortunately closed now due to the pandemic, so I can't even find a replacement.I would never recommend something so expensive and so faulty to anyone.

title: Dies (permanently) if you don't keep it constantly charged
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on March 31, 2020
text: Here is a tidbit Apple doesn't bother sharing. If you don't use the pen and charge it regularly, it will die and not be able to be recharged. The amount of time can vary from 1-3 months, but if you forget to or don't need to use it for that amount of time, you basically have a ridiculously overpriced model of a pen that is useless in all ways. Disappointing that it costs so much, disappointing that Apple doesn't warn you or use a different battery (other than li-ion) that doesn't have this problem, and disappointing that Apple doesn't replace these seriously flaws pens or have an option to fix them.

title: Not as good as the S Pen on Samsung devices
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on December 4, 2021
text: I like the apple pencil. I've tried several different third party ones and this definitely works the best with iOS devices. The apple pencil feels like writing with a big plastic pencil on a window. It's also obnoxiously loud whenever you press down on the screen. If you're in a quiet room, people are going to hear you writing with this thing, which I find mildly annoying in meetings and such. I love my new iPad but I still think the S Pens on my older Samsung tablets had a more natural feel overall & were better for drawing. Good for light sketching and notes, would recommend getting a separate (non iPad) drawing tablet for professional artists. It's ridiculously overpriced for what it is, considering other manufacturers include pressure sensitive styluses that work better than this at no additional cost with their tablets. Again, still the best for ipad, but not great.

title: love it
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on February 4, 2022
text: i always get finicky about spending so much money on apple products & then i remember "it's apple" and i could buy 10 cheaper pencils and none would come close to the perfection apple has created with theiro products. i do love the apple pencil. it sticks right to the side of my ipad which is convenient so i don't lose it. also it charges magnetically on my ipad so even better. it never dies on me so it's got great battery life.  it is just perfect - there's nothing i don't like about it. feels great in my hand and writes like a charm. normally with other stylus pens or knock-off pencils my handwriting is all over the place. and forget about drawing. not the apple pencil though. my lines are precise and factory where i want them. you can use more pressure to get darker lines and you don't have to worry about your wrist/hand leaving behind there own drag-marks. apple has perfected their pencil so what i thought was "expensive" really is well deserved for such a smooth, sturdy & clever product. when you buy directly from apple there's usually no deals. i always check with amazon first because sometimes they will have a deal going on [for brand new authentic apple products] and you can purchase apple care with them during checkout. so be sure to check with amazon first if your interested in saving some money.thank you apple for the great product! & thank you amazon for the discount & super fast shipping.

title: Worth the money
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on November 5, 2021
text: As much as I hate to say this the extra money for the gen 2 Apple Pencil is worth it. Granted you have to have an iPad that's compatible but if you do don't bother with anything else. Had originally bought a cheaper option but once I was able made the switch and the difference was noticable immediately.Especially if you are spending long periods drawing you'll see that it's the more responsive, smoother, and easier option (the tap to change to eraser function is my favorite). The wireless charging makes it super easy to keep charged so I do not have to worry about it running out of battery life so I can draw for ages.

title: This is a must accessory for the iPad
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on February 17, 2022
text: I‚Äôm not an artist, and I prefer typing notes rather than writing because I can type faster. But I tried a knockoff Apple Pencil (the one that‚Äôs like $30 and has great reviews) and instantly realized that the Apple Pencil is super useful for navigating the iPadOS UI. I ditched the knockoff and went with the real thing because I didn‚Äôt want something that was 90% good (plus the knockoff had to charge separately, I kept turning it off by mistake when using it). I use the Apple Pencil as a non-artist (I don‚Äôt even have a drawing app on my iPad) as well as someone who prefers to type out notes. As with most Apple over-priced accessories (like the AirPods) it‚Äôs hard to explain in words why it‚Äôs so good. Just buy the real Apple Pencil, use it‚Ä¶ if you don‚Äôt like it just return it. But you won‚Äôt return it, because even if you just use it to navigate the iPadOS UI (like I do) you‚Äôll want to continue to use it.

title: My old one broke after 3 years
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on August 23, 2022
text: You just can‚Äôt get any better than an Apple Pencil. With the write screen protector it‚Äôs literally like writing with a pen and paper. After 3 years my toddler niece got ahold of it and broke it somehow. It didn‚Äôt charge anymore. Which was a rather expensive waste of money. I tried using a cheaper stylus but it didn‚Äôt connect to certain apps I used all the time (rough animator, Procreate) and the palm rejection didn‚Äôt work. So I came back and spent $130 for another apple pencil. And I gotta say it‚Äôs pricey, but worth it. I will never use anything other than an Apple Pencil ever again.

title: Review for Apple Pencil 2 on  iPad Pro 5th edition m1 chip no home button
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on July 12, 2021
text: The pen works great for art or writing,  but that‚Äôs about it,  with the 5th edition iPad Pro with no home button it will not swipe up from the bottom to change apps,  or if you try to use it as a plain stylus  pen to navigate through or operate regular apps it fails.  You may be able to open a app from the Home Screen but then it will write inside that app and you can not close the app by swipe with the pencil. I‚Äôm a little shocked that apple did not come up with a rubber tip for the opposite side of the pencil to correct the issue.  I spoke with apple extensively and there is no present correction for this issue so a return is being processed

title: Super Glad I bought it!
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on October 1, 2021
text: I am illustrating stories and books that I write, and wanted to try my hand at digital imagery. I had purchased a different pencil to start with because it was cheaper and guaranteed. Now, that was a mistake. I almost gave up all together. However, I tried the Apple 2 while it was on sale. I‚Äôm very happy. It attaches and charges very easily. This makes it super helpful. The downside - it is expensive, and if I want anything for it I do have to go through the Apple store itself, i.e. maybe a new tip. I wouldn‚Äôt trust anything that says it is compatible after my last experience.

title: Love it!!
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on May 1, 2022
text: I bought a new iPad so I had to get this 2nd generation. I didn't think it would be that much of a difference from the 1st gen but the magnetic charging has made my life so much easier. I'm a digital artist so now I no longer have to charge one or the other, I just charge my iPad and magnetize the pencil to it then bam! Both charging!! I love ITTTTT. I've never had it start to die on me now because even I'm done it just automatically charges back up when I put it back in its place

title: Worth the money.
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on June 17, 2022
text: I am obsessed with my Apple Pencil. I utilize my iPad and Pencil everyday for work and personal use.Admittedly, I was suuuper skeptical of its value (let‚Äôs be real, that price tag?! mega steep!) and tried a few cheap dupes before testing out the Pencil. I design and write a lot with my iPad mini gen 6, and I can confirm that this Pencil is, in fact, dreamy, durable, and of the highest quality. Magnetizes to the side for easy storage. Charges fast and keeps a battery for a long while. Writes well, with defined strokes and pressure. Notate, sketch, draw, plan, etc. to your heart‚Äôs content. Paired with the GoodNotes app, it‚Äôs like Heaven. Save up for this one, it‚Äôs an investment piece and will become indispensable. You will not be disappointed.

title: Worth it.
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on September 11, 2021
text: I‚Äôve been using an off-brand stylus for the past three years and I loved it. Unfortunately, with my new iPad, it was getting quite bothersome when I wrote notes. So, I‚Äôve went ahead and gave the Apple Pencil 2 a try (used one was just $95) and it is absolutely worth it. The handwriting to text is a great option and the way it writes in notes is superb. Very smooth, quite artistic, and a comfortable experience. I would say to wait for a sale or buy a used one, but I think the original pricing may be still worth it given the far-superior experience.

title: The gold standard in iPad pencils
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on July 25, 2022
text: I upgraded my iPad, and needed a 2nd Gen Apple Pencil. This Apple Pencil has a one-piece design, meaning that you do not have to remove a cap to charge the pencil. Simply place the pencil on the iPad's metal case at the top of your screen, and the iPad recognizes and charges the pencil. It charges quickly and works well. If you do a lot of drawing, consider purchasing silicone tip covers and/or an extra pencil tip.

title: Nice addition to you iPad provided you "need" it.
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on July 3, 2020
text: I got a new iPad and figured having this pen would be a nice-to-have accessory. Personally I don't have a real use for it aside from tinkering around with it on drawing apps. I'm finding new uses for it with process/workflow apps however it's still limited at this point. I'm sure someone in design/drafting would have a real need for this but, for me, it's more a nifty accessory.That said, it's quite accurate and no lag. Battery life is good however not really an issue since you recharge it by attaching it to the iPad. Biggest gripe is that the pen is super smooth so it's a little difficult getting a proper grip on it. I'm getting a skin for the pen so that will hopefully address that issue.

title: Good writing device
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on March 19, 2021
text: The pencil works great.  I like the idea of being able to store and keep it charged through the magnetic attachment built into it.  Even though the magnetic slot in the ipad (2020 11 iPad Pro) has a good connection, do not trust on it to keep the pencil secured particularly when you travel or carry it during the day.  Occasionally the pencil will be dislocated and it can be lost.I also found (after using the LogicTech Crayon) that I had to get use to using the double tap to select the eraser function.  Once you get accustomed to it, it works perfectly.  With my handwriting I have to use it all the time.I would also recommend that if you purchase this, you also purchase some replacement tips for it.  My tip has not worn away - as yet, but it cannot help to wear, and you do not want to possibly damage your ipad or tablet screen.I would certainly buy this again if needed.

title: Bought new, but item not packed new
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on October 3, 2020
text: The item itself looked fine.  Didn't seem damaged, but the Apple Pencil, which was purchased from Amazon.com Services LLC, was already unwrapped when it arrived.  This was sold as new, so we didn't want to take for granted that it would continue to be okay, or would hold up to a warranty.  Apple was called, and they confirmed that it was not packed the way it should have been.  We don't know if it was actually used, and if used, how long it had already been used, or maybe someone just didn't want it and returned it after trying it.  We don't know if it came that way from the apple store, or if it may have been unwrapped at the distribution center.  We returned the item, and, instead, bought directly from the apple store.  That item came packed new.

title: Apple pencil that works with Ipad Pro 11 2021.
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on December 24, 2022
text: ¬†This Pencil definitely works with Ipad Pro 11 (2021).This is an Apple Pencil 2nd Generation.What i like about this product:-its an apple product made for an apple device.-ive got a great deal at amazon.-very responsive to the touch screen.(like real time)-i can see accuracy when using it. Very smooth when you draw.-lightweight and it seems like its pressure sensitive when you draw. Ive noticed it when i was using highlighter when drawing.-works well with my ipad pro 11(2021)-it attached to you Ipad so it doesn't get lost and automatically charge.So far i don't have any dislike with this product, however i just have a note for future buyers:-the pen is very smooth that it might slide if you have sweaty hands.-it has no charging port, and only charge directly to your Ipad when its attached.-it came with a 5% charge so you have to charge it before using it but i must say mine charged fast. I left it attached to my tablet and when i came back after an hour its already fully charged.-i cant tell how long the battery will last but i used mine for simple editing for maybe 2 to 3 hrs and it only used less than 20% of its battery. Since i attached it back to my Ipad it just went on charging again until its full.-i haven't noticed any extra tips in the box but i guess because it will last long and has a durable tip.-no side buttons nor like an eraser type on the top end. I thought it look sleek though.-i believe that this is way much better than just buying an alternative pencil for your ipad.Im pretty much satisfied with my purchase and will continue to explore its other features.This is just a suggestion, if you are planning to get a pencil for you Ipad, it would still be better to get an Apple brand so you can ensure compatibility of the product and enjoy its complete functions/features. I know some will say it may a bit costly but try to check amazon once it a while cause there are times that they offer great deals.

title: A must have iPad accessory!!
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on November 23, 2021
text: Things I love:Wirelessly charges and strong attachment to iPadMuch better build and convenience than the cheap active stylists, not withstanding the features missing from the cheaper devices.At $130, it‚Äôs hard to stretch for unless you‚Äôre an artist or someone who will use the pressure sensitivity to the max. However, on sale at $99 it makes it much more appealing, just for the wireless charging and attachment if you have any compatible iPad.If you don‚Äôt care about having the Apple brand and don‚Äôt mind a few inconveniences; get an off brand pencil.If you‚Äôre an Apple diehard and love the ease of use, get this.(For Left Handed folk) - It‚Äôs very obviously focused on right handed people, like most things in this world. iPad/Air Pro 11 and 12.9 both attach to the right hand side when the device is in portrait mode. Of course this isn‚Äôt detrimental, it‚Äôs just something I didn‚Äôt think about when I bought it. As well as the logo and lettering being upside down as most writing utensils have.TL;DR - It‚Äôs worth it!

title: less anxiety about charging!
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on June 17, 2020
text: I'd written a lenghty review on the ipad pro version I have that the 2.0 pencil charges with, but wanted to note here: the pencil slips and slides slightly for those that use the ipad pro for art!For accuracy, I got a Paperlike matte screen protector that works perfectly, no more sliding or slipping. However please buy the screen protector from Paperlike directly, the ones on amazon are fake and do not work well.I have a 10in (11in with the whole ipad dimensions) ipad pro!Otherwise I much prefer this pencil to the previous 1.0 pencil. I have friends that have it and how they charge it (for on the go activities) makes me very anxious and worry about the pencil snapping if you bump it while charging it directly connected to the ipad...so I'm very glad this 2.0 version charges magnetically. Unfortunately it isn't backwards compatible (can't use previous versions of the ipad pro to charge the 2.0 pencil), but definitely worth the wait to ease my anxiety!

title: Open box or worse being sold as new! Buy from reputable brick and mortar vendor or Apple direct!!
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on December 7, 2020
text: I ordered two NEW 2nd Gen pencils. One of them showed up clearly a previously opened and then re-wrapped in what amounts to a sandwich bag. For 130 bucks, that's kind of a slap in the face. Buy these local, or Apple direct. This is not the kind of thing you want to order from Amazon's zero accountability, fly-by-night vendors. It's too expensive and too easy to superficially counterfeit. Who knows where it's been or what it's been used for...what if the previous owner was an itchy fella?!? Best case scenario is it's counterfeit and the battery is not a dangerous knockoff.  Well I guess best case scenario is Amazon valuing their customers, but you know.The one that was not previously opened and used works fine. I'm not touching the other one.

title: This is my third 2nd generation Apple Pencil, but that is my fault
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on April 8, 2022
text: I got my first Apple 2nd generation pencil to use with my iPad Pro. I loved the convenience of the magnetic charging, and the Bluetooth connectivity, and all the amazing things it did. Of course I misplaced it, and after trying to find it, I gave up, and ordered another one, and figured if I found the first one, I would have a spare. One of my relatives got an iPad Pro as a gift, and while I loved the Apple Pencil, I am not very creative with drawing, and my relative is. After letting them try my Pencil, and seeing what an artist could do with it, I gave them my second one. I kept telling myself that I didn‚Äôt need it, and I did try a bunch of cheaper electronic stylus, but the experience was horrible. I finally decided to just buy another one, making number three. I won‚Äôt bore everyone with what it does, you can read about it online, but nothing available can replace the Apple version, and all the things it does, like swipe to bring up a note, and write on it, and have it convert to real text, is just one of many different things that you can do. You have to tip your hat to Apple for making this such a compelling product. Extremely recommended!

title: BUYER BEWARE!!! Got defective pencil- also got charged restocking fee when returned.
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on December 16, 2021
text: ***Buyer Beware***. I got a defective pencil, it would be inconsistent with the drawing and would need to be run over a few lines over and over. The buttons weren't responsive either. Long story short- I returned this pencil in the original box it came in (See Picture). Few days later, I see that I am charged a restocking fee, even though the item arrived defective, through no fault of my own.Called customer care twice, got hung up both times, agents kept reading off of a script that there is nothing they can do about the restocking fee.I went online and read that it is ILLEGAL to charge restocking fee for an item that arrived damaged. Amazon has potentially lost a prime member for good. First, we trust the quality and buy on Amazon and then the sellers make free money by selling counterfeit products. I know they wont do anything but at least I can inform others to be cautious when buying expensive things off here.*Spend extra and buy off Costco or Apple store.*

title: Falls off the iPad too easily :/
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on May 19, 2021
text: For what it cost, I'd like it to not fall off the iPad magnets as easily as it does... replacing the pen if lost in public would be unjustifiable for the cost and for that reason I don't bring it with me when I leave the house.I also had higher expectations, I'd been using a knock off pen that cost around $30 that works great comparatively. Although features the apple gen 2 has is little more convenient for programs like procreate where switching between two tools can be quiet fast with the double tap on the apple pen.Honestly I am just not that blown away. Apple is too hyped, but it's still the best out there...I guess!? Technology has a way to go before it really "wows" me. Rating it at 3 starts because I can't leave the house with it on the side of my iPad, even if my  case secures it to the charging magnets, the possibility of losing it is still too risky for how easily it just can knock off the side.

title: Fantastic for the artist, casual or non!
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on November 30, 2020
text: I am an artist. I really love tablets and drawing digitally. I bought an Ipad Air 4 2020 recently and this pencil to accessorize. I really love the new apple pencil, coming from the gen 1. This is much easier to hold, grippier, fun to use. It pairs so well and it's magnetically charged which was a huuuuuge change from what I used to have to do with the awkward "charge it from the bottom" of the 2017/2018 ipads. I definitely feel this one has more accuracy even though many people say that the apple pencil 2 is similar to 1. I beg to differ. I've used this pencil seamlessly on procreate, pixiv sketch, medibang paint, etc. If you're an anime artist like me and you're casual, you WILL LOVE this. ONLY complaint is I wish the double tap had more options to switch between. Not just eraser and color palette
